olog.title: Prompt as Pharmakon: Ambivalence, Mediation, and the Double-Edged Power of Language in AI

entities.label: Prompt
entities.description: A linguistic or symbolic intervention that mediates between user, machine, and output; functions as both cure and poison (cf. Derrida's pharmakon).

entities.label: Pharmakon
entities.description: A concept from Derrida denoting something that is both remedy and toxin, structuring the ambivalence of mediation and technology.

entities.label: User
entities.description: An agent who crafts prompts, seeking to shape or channel the outputs of an AI system.

entities.label: AI System
entities.description: A generative apparatus that responds to prompts, mediating between intention and result.

entities.label: Ritual Mediation
entities.description: The structured, often repeated, use of prompts to produce, contain, or transform meaning (cf. Stiegler, chaos magick).

entities.label: Ambivalence
entities.description: The simultaneous capacity of prompts to enable and undermine, heal and harm, clarify and confuse.

entities.label: Transindividuation
entities.description: The process by which individuals and collectives are shaped and transformed through shared technical and symbolic practices (cf. Stiegler).

morphisms.how: Channels user intention into machine response, structuring the space of possible outputs.
Frames the prompt as both remedy and poison, productive and disruptive (Derrida).
morphisms.why: Reveals the double-edged nature of mediation.

morphisms.how: Crafts and iterates prompts in structured, sometimes ritualized ways (cf. chaos magick, Stiegler).
morphisms.why: Seeks to harness or contain the generative power of the apparatus.

morphisms.how: Shared prompt practices shape collective and individual subjectivity (Stiegler).
morphisms.why: Transforms both users and systems through iterative engagement.

morphisms.how: The unpredictable effects of prompts require ongoing adjustment and reflection.
morphisms.why: Sustains the dynamic, open-ended nature of prompting.

recursive_refinement.question: What does the pharmakon nature of prompts enable?
recursive_refinement.answer: A recognition of the double-edged, ambivalent power of language in AI mediation.

recursive_refinement.question: What does ritual mediation require?
recursive_refinement.answer: Iterative, reflexive engagement with both technical and symbolic dimensions of prompting.

recursive_refinement.question: What new entanglement does this produce?
recursive_refinement.answer: A field where users, machines, and meanings are co-constituted through ongoing, ambivalent mediation.

olog.thesis: Prompts function as pharmakon—at once remedy and poison—structuring the ambivalent, transformative, and ritualized mediation between user and AI, and shaping new forms of collective and individual subjectivity.
olog.problem_statement: How can users and societies navigate the ambivalent, double-edged power of prompts as both tools of control and sources of unpredictability in AI systems?
vectors_of_influence: Challenges instrumentalist views of language and AI mediation (Derrida, Stiegler).
Enables new practices of ritual, reflexivity, and collective individuation in prompt engineering.
Connects to broader debates in philosophy of technology, media theory, and the politics of language.
olog.olog_prompt: For any context of prompting, identify all agents, forms of mediation, and ambivalences; specify all morphisms that enable, structure, or transform the effects of prompts; for each, describe what is transformed, how, and why it matters; recursively refine by asking what each process enables or requires, and what new entanglements are produced; conclude with a thesis, problem statement, and connection to broader systems.
